results.title: Knowledgebase-Driven Exploration and Experimental Verification of Simvastatin's Inhibitory Impact on P2X7/NLRP3 Inflammasome Pathway.
results.text_hl: To achieve this goal, a @<m>DISEASE_Depressive_Disorder</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003866 @@@depression@@@ database was first constructed, and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ was used as an input to predict potential targets using machine/deep learning methods.

results.title: Simvastatin attenuated sickness behavior and fever in a murine model of endotoxemia.
results.text_hl: KEY FINDINGS: Pretreatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ blunted most of the assessed parameters related to @DISEASE_Sick_Sinus_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D012804 @@@sickness syndrome@@@, including @<m>DISEASE_Depressive_Disorder</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003866 @@@depressive@@@-like behavior and @<m>DISEASE_Depressive_Disorder</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003866 @@@depressed locomotor@@@ activity, and attenuated @CHEMICAL_Lipopolysaccharides @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008070 @@@LPS@@@-induced @DISEASE_Fever @DISEASE_MESH:D005334 @@@fever@@@.

citations.NLM: Oliveira MK, Dos Santos RS, Cabral LDM, Vilela FC, Giusti-Paiva A. Simvastatin attenuated sickness behavior and fever in a murine model of endotoxemia. Life Sci. 2020 Aug 1;254():117701. PMID: 32387414

results.title: Effects of RhoA on depression-like behavior in prenatally stressed offspring rats.
results.text_hl: After administration of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ to PS @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@, the expression of @GENE_RHOA @GENE_117273 @@@RhoA@@@ and @GENE_ROCK2 @GENE_25537 @@@ROCK2@@@ was significantly reduced, alleviating @<m>DISEASE_Depressive_Disorder</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003866 @@@depression@@@-like behavior.

citations.NLM: Zhou J, Ma Y, Chen J, Yao D, Feng C, Dong Y, Ren Y, Ma H, Wang Z, Li G, Li H, Zhu Z. Effects of RhoA on depression-like behavior in prenatally stressed offspring rats. Behav Brain Res. 2022 Aug 26;432():113973. PMID: 35728732

results.title: Simvastatin Improves Behavioral Disorders and Hippocampal Inflammatory Reaction by NMDA-Mediated Anti-inflammatory Function in MPTP-Treated Mice.
results.text_hl: Our results showed that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ can improve the cognitive function, @DISEASE_Anxiety @DISEASE_MESH:D001007 @@@anxiety@@@, and @<m>DISEASE_Depressive_Disorder</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003866 @@@depression@@@ of @DISEASE_Parkinson_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D010300 @@@PD@@@ @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@ with @CHEMICAL_1_Methyl_4_phenyl_1_2_3_6_tetrahydropyridine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D015632 @@@MPTP@@@ injury.

results.title: An online experimental medicine trial on the effect of 28-day simvastatin administration on emotional processing, reward learning, working memory and salivary cortisol in healthy volunteers at risk for depression: OxSTEP protocol
results.text_hl: Here, we aim to test the neuropsychological effects of 28-day @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ administration versus placebo, in healthy volunteers at risk for @<m>DISEASE_Depressive_Disorder</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003866 @@@depression@@@ owing to loneliness.

results.title: An experimental medicine study of the effects of simvastatin on emotional processing, reward learning, verbal memory, and inflammation in healthy volunteers
results.text_hl: Clinical studies suggest that the highly lipophilic, anti-@DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ molecule, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, might be an ideal candidate for drug repurposing in the treatment of @<m>DISEASE_Depressive_Disorder</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003866 @@@depression@@@.
